{"step_by_step_thinking": "Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (SCID) is a group of rare disorders caused by mutations in different genes involved in the development and function of infection-fighting immune cells. BTK gene is involved in X-linked agammaglobulinemia, not SCID. ZAP70, IL2RG, and JAK3 are all involved in different types of SCID.", "answer_choice": "A"}
